au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikBone3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikBone3D

  • public class FabrikBone3D
extends Object
    A class to represent a FabrikBone3D object.

    A FabrikBone3D consists of a start location, an end location and a FabrikJoint3D which can constrain the rotation of the bone with regard to a previous bone in an IK chain either as a ball joint or as a hinge joint constrained about a local or global axis.

    Version:
    0.3 - 29/12/2015
    See Also:
    FabrikJoint3D

    • Constructor Detail

      • FabrikBone3D

        public FabrikBone3D(Vec3f startLocation,
                    Vec3f endLocation)
        Create a new FabrikBone3D from a start and end location as provided by a pair of Vec3fs.

        The mLength property is calculated and set from the provided locations. All other properties are set to their default values.

        Instantiating a FabrikBone3D with the exact same start and end location, and hence a length of zero, will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of this bone.
        endLocation - The end location of this bone.

      • FabrikBone3D

        public FabrikBone3D(Vec3f startLocation,
                    Vec3f endLocation,
                    String name)
        Create a new FabrikBone3D from a start and end location and a String.

        This constructor is merely for convenience if you intend on working with named bones, and internally calls the FabrikBone3D(Vec3f, Vec3f) constructor.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of this bone.
        endLocation - The end location of this bone.
        name - The name of this bone.

      • FabrikBone3D

        public FabrikBone3D(Vec3f startLocation,
                    Vec3f directionUV,
                    float length)
        Create a new FabrikBone3D from a start location, a direction unit vector and a length.

        The end location of the bone is calculated as the start location plus the direction unit vector multiplied by the length (which must be a positive value). All other properties are set to their default values. *

        If this constructor is provided with a direction unit vector of magnitude zero, or with a length less than or equal to zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of this bone.
        directionUV - The direction unit vector of this bone.
        length - The length of this bone.

      • FabrikBone3D

        public FabrikBone3D(Vec3f startLocation,
                    Vec3f directionUV,
                    float length,
                    String name)
        Create a named FabrikBone3D from a start location, a direction unit vector, a bone length and a name.

        This constructor is merely for convenience if you intend on working with named bones, and internally calls the FabrikBone3D(Vec3f, Vec3f, float) constructor.

        If the provided length argument is zero or if the direction is a zero vector then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of this bone.
        directionUV - The direction unit vector of this bone.
        length - The length of this bone.
        name - The name of this bone.

      • FabrikBone3D

        public FabrikBone3D(Vec3f startLocation,
                    Vec3f directionUV,
                    float length,
                    Colour4f colour)
        Create a new FabrikBone3D from a start location, a direction unit vector, a bone length and a colour.

        This constructor is merely for convenience if you intend on working with named bones, and internally calls the FabrikBone3D(Vec3f, Vec3f, float) constructor.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of this bone.
        directionUV - The direction unit vector of this bone.
        length - The length of this bone.
        colour - The colour to draw this bone.

      • FabrikBone3D

        public FabrikBone3D(FabrikBone3D source)
        Copy constructor.

        Takes a source FabrikBone3D object and copies all properties into the new FabrikBone3D by value. Once this is done, there are no shared references between the source and the new object, and they are exact copies of each other.

        Parameters:
        source - The bone to use as the basis for this new bone.

    • Method Detail

      • length

        public float length()
        Return the length of this bone. This value is calculated when the bone is constructed and used throughout the lifetime of the bone.
        Returns:
        The length of this bone, as stored in the mLength property.
        See Also:
        mLength

      • liveLength

        public float liveLength()
        Return the live (i.e. live calculated) length of this bone from its current start and end locations.
        Returns:
        The 'live' calculated distance between the start and end locations of this bone.

      • setBoneConnectionPoint

        public void setBoneConnectionPoint(FabrikBone3D.BoneConnectionPoint3D bcp)
        Specify the bone connection point of this bone.

        This connection point property controls whether, when THIS bone connects to another bone in another chain, it does so at the start or the end of the bone we connect to.

        The default is BoneConnectionPoint3D.END.

        Parameters:
        bcp - The bone connection point to use (BoneConnectionPOint3D.START or BoneConnectionPoint3D.END).

      • getBoneConnectionPoint

        public FabrikBone3D.BoneConnectionPoint3D getBoneConnectionPoint()
        Return the bone connection point for THIS bone, which will be either BoneConnectionPoint.START or BoneConnectionPoint.END.

        This connection point property controls whether, when THIS bone connects to another bone in another chain, it does so at the start or the end of the bone we connect to.

        Returns:
        The bone connection point for this bone.

      • setHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the clockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees (0.0f to 180.0f inclusive).

        If a constraint angle outside of this range is provided, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The relative clockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

      • getHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public float getHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs()
        Return the clockwise constraint angle of this bone's hinge joint in degrees.
        Returns:
        The clockwise constraint angle of this bone's hinge joint in degrees.

      • setHingeJointAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setHingeJointAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the anticlockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees (0.0f to 180.0f inclusive).

        If a constraint angle outside of this range is provided, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The relative anticlockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

      • getHingeJointAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

      • setBallJointConstraintDegs

        public void setBallJointConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the rotor constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees (0.0f to 180.0f inclusive).

        If a constraint angle outside of this range is provided, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The angle in degrees relative to the previous bone which this bone is constrained to.

      • getBallJointConstraintDegs

        public float getBallJointConstraintDegs()
        Return the anticlockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees.
        Returns:
        The anticlockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees.

      • getDirectionUV

        public Vec3f getDirectionUV()
        Get the direction unit vector between the start location and end location of this bone.

        If the opposite (i.e. end to start) location is required then you can simply negate the provided direction.

        Returns:
        The direction unit vector of this bone.
        See Also:
        Vec3f.negate(), Vec3f.negated()

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth(float lineWidth)
        Set the line width with which to draw this bone.

        If the provided parameter is outside the valid range of 1.0f to 64.0f inclusive then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        lineWidth - The value to set on the mLineWidth property.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set the name of this bone, capped to 100 characters if required.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to set.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Get the name of this bone.

        If the bone has not been specifically named through a constructor or by using the setName(String) method, then the name will be the default of "UnnamedFabrikBone3D".

        Returns:
        String

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return a concise, human readable description of this FabrikBone3D as a String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • setStartLocation

        public void setStartLocation(Vec3f location)
        Set the start location of this bone from a provided Vec3f.

        No validation is performed on the value of the start location - be aware that adding a bone with identical start and end locations will result in undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        location - The bone start location specified as a Vec3f.
